articles.title: Copper and the (very) big fund short: Andy Home
articles.description: By Andy HomeLONDON, Aug 21 (Reuters) - Peace has broken out in the  Chilean copper industry with two major potential labour  flashpoints resolved in as many...

articles.title: Herbalife distributors claim in $1B suit events were a...
articles.description: MIAMI (AP) - Patricia and Jeff Rodgers figured they did everything right to get rich beyond their wildest dreams selling Herbalife health and personal care...

articles.author: https://www.facebook.com/DailyMailCeleb
articles.title: Nicki Minaj commands attention in a gold armor inspired bodysuit with spandex shorts as she performs
articles.description: She won Best Hip Hop Video for her song Chun-Li at the 2018 MTV Video Music Awards in New York City on Sunday. And during the awards show, Nicki Minaj performed a variety of her hit songs.

articles.author: https://www.facebook.com/DailyMail
articles.title: 20 million year old primate jaw bones show that lemurs came to Madagascar much later than thought
articles.description: Experts from the University of Southern California now believe the fossil of the strange creature wasn't a bat, as previously thought, but an ancient relative of the primate known as aye-aye.

articles.author: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/home/search.html?s=&authornamef=Associated+Press
articles.title: AP News in Brief at 12:04 a.m. EDT
articles.description: Colorado man charged with murder says wife killed daughtersDENVER (AP) - A Colorado man told police that he killed his pregnant wife in "a rage" when he...

articles.author: Melanie Burton
articles.title: Rising costs, trade worries tarnish BHP profit jump, record dividend
articles.description: Concerns over rising costs and the impact of trade tensions between the United States and China weighed on shares of leading miner BHP on Tuesday after a 33 percent jump in annual underlying profit still missed forecasts.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Wall Street opens higher on earnings, trade optimism
articles.description: U.S. stocks opened higher on Tuesday, helped by some encouraging earnings reports and anticipation that planned trade talks between the United States and China would help resolve the spat between the world's two largest economies.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Defensives drive European shares higher before U.S.-China trade talks
articles.description: A bounce across defensive sectors propelled European shares higher on Tuesday, though trading was cautious before trade talks between the United States and China later in the week.

articles.author: Kylie MacLellan
articles.title: UK says aims to boost exports to 35 percent of GDP, gives no timeframe
articles.description: Britain aims to boost exports to 35 percent of gross domestic product after leaving the European Union as it looks to increase trade ties with the rest of the world, its trade minister said on Tuesday, but he gave no timeframe for reaching the target.

articles.author: Jeff Mason
articles.title: Exclusive: Trump does not anticipate much from China trade talks this week
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump does not expect much progress from trade talks with China this week in Washington, he told Reuters on Monday.

articles.author: Henning Gloystein
articles.title: Oil mixed on tighter U.S. outlook, while U.S.-China trade spat weighs
articles.description: Oil prices were mixed on Tuesday, with U.S. fuel markets seen to be tightening while the Sino-U.S. trade dispute dragged on international crude contracts.

articles.author: Henning Gloystein
articles.title: Oil edges up on U.S. sanctions against Iran, but trade dispute weighs
articles.description: Oil prices edged up on Tuesday, supported by expectations of supply cuts once U.S. sanctions against Iran bite in November, but capped by worries a Sino-U.S. trade dispute will drag on fuel demand growth.

articles.author: Shinichi Saoshiro
articles.title: Global Markets: Asian stocks up on hopes trade tensions ease, Trump comments hit dollar
articles.description: Asian stocks rose on Tuesday, supported by hopes Beijing and Washington would dial back trade hostilities, though comments from the U.S. president about the yuan and Federal Reserve policy capped gains and weighed on the dollar.

articles.author: Shreyashi   Sanyal
articles.title: Wall Street up on trade hopes, S&P equals longest bull run
articles.description: The benchmark S&P 500 edged closer to a record high on Tuesday, matching its longest-ever bull-market run, as U.S. stocks rose after some encouraging earnings reports and on hopes that the United States and China could resolve their tariff dispute.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: UK government aims to boost exports to 35 percent of GDP
articles.description: The British government will set out a new export strategy on Tuesday aimed at boosting exports to 35 percent of gross domestic product, as it looks to increase trade ties with the rest of the world after leaving the European Union.

articles.author: Huw Jones
articles.title: Analysis: Britain can't afford to close door to EU banks after Brexit
articles.description: Britain is expected to keep the door open for European Union banks and investors after Brexit to try to preserve London's global financial clout, irrespective of whether it gets a good trade deal from the bloc, bankers and industry officials say.

articles.author: Shinichi Saoshiro
articles.title: Global Markets: Asia stocks capped, dollar droops following Trump comments
articles.description: Asian stocks were capped and the dollar dipped on Tuesday after U.S. President Donald Trump accused China and Europe of manipulating their currencies and said he was "not thrilled" with the Federal Reserve for hiking interest rates.

articles.author: Ahmed Rasheed
articles.title: Exclusive: Iraq to ask U.S. for exemptions on some Iran sanctions
articles.description: Iraq's economy is so closely linked to Iran that Baghdad is going to ask Washington for permission to ignore some U.S. sanctions on its neighbour, Iraqi government and central bank officials said.

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.title: Foreign automakers oppose Trump NAFTA plan as U.S-Mexico talks resume
articles.description: Foreign-brand automakers with U.S. plants do not support Trump administration rules to raise the amount of local content in North American-made vehicles, a group representing companies including Toyota Motor Corp , Volkswagen AG and Hyundai Motor Co  has toldâ€¦

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Gold prices extend gains as dollar sags after Trump remarks
articles.description: Gold prices rose on the back of a weaker U.S. dollar on Tuesday, extending gains into a third session after U.S. president Donald Trump said he was "not thrilled" with the U.S. Federal Reserve for raising interest rates.
